Title:
Paraboeremia camelliae, P. litseae and P. oligotrophica spp.
nov.
Keywords:
Oligotrophic fungi, plant pathogen, morphology, phylogeny,
taxonomy
Abstract:
Three new species, i.e.Â Paraboeremia camelliae isolated
from Camellia sp., P. litseae from Litsea sp., and P. oligotrophica from
carbonatite in a cave, are described, illustrated and compared with
closely related taxa in this paper. Phylogenetic analysis based on the
multi-locus sequences of ITS, LSU, TUB2 and RPB2 confirmed the
distinction of these species in Paraboeremia. These species were
discovered from habitats or hosts that are previously unknown from this
genus.
